column4: Hello, please, how to make active mp3 decoding in Hardy? I tried with steps for earlier versions of Ubuntu, but no luck...
you mean for rhythmbox and the like?
ah, use make mp3's when you rip
for sound-juicer, look at the help, preferences, all the way at the bottom
I take that back, preferences doesn't have it in hardy .. a sec
you have gstreamer0.10-plugins-ugly   and gstreamer0.10-plugins-ugly-multiverse installed?
I think not multiverse... Let me check...
ugly or bad? It seems that for some it is bad, for other it is ugly.
But I can leave bad, since it is there? Sorry for asking stupid questions, but I read somewhere about collision between the two, and that some earlier Ubuntu used bad, and the other ugly.
the bad are the ones that aren't very polished, as in written well. ugly are fine, but have licensing/patent issues, like mp3
it doesn't matter. If you have any qualms, I'd remove both bad versions
